thread.title: Leicester derelict building fire damages cars and closes roads
thread.title_full: Leicester derelict building fire damages cars and closes roads

title: Leicester derelict building fire damages cars and closes roads
text:
Leicester derelict building fire damages cars and closes roads 9 February 2017 Image copyright Leicestershire Fire and Rescue Image caption The fire spread to a car dealership next door Up to 12 cars have been damaged during a large fire at a derelict industrial building in Leicester. 
A number of roads have also been closed in the city centre as a result of the blaze which started at about 02:40 GMT in St Margaret's Way. 
About 45 firefighters tackled the flames which spread to another building and caused damage to the dealership. 
It is not yet clear if anyone was inside the building which has now partially collapsed. Image copyright Leicestershire Fire and Rescue Image caption Firefighters have been at the scene of the blaze since the early hours of the morning Image copyright Leicestershire Fire and Rescue Image caption Cars have been sprayed with foam to prevent the fire spreading further
